titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Alanson Trigg, Indictment

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Warren Equity & Criminal Court August Term 1863
The Commonwealth of Kenty
Against
Alanson Trigg
Indictment for a Misdemeanor

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendant by this attorney who plead not guilty and thereupon came the following Jury to wit. G A Kirby James F Ewing, Calvin A Garrison Joseph Fallon H Johnson Robert Graham Henry Vance H B Elrod Wm Davenport Wm H Kinnard V K Hines and H J Neighbors who were elected true and sworn and having heard the evidence returned the following verdict to wit. We of the Jury find the defendant A Trigg guilty of permitting each of his Slaves Jerry and Beverly to go at large and hire themselves out for their own benefit as charged in this Indictment. C A Garrison Foreman. It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Eighty Dollars and the cost herein and may be taken &c.

A Copy Test L L Cooke C W E & C C
5th Oct
1863

Comwlth
vs
A Trigg
Copy Judgt
A Copy for Deft
